channel.title: VPS hosting problem
channel.description:
Remote Desktop Connection. I've transferred my source over to the VPS desktop, and when I run my .bat, everything goes correctly. So, I have my .bat running on my VPS. I go to run my client, and it stays at 0%?
For some reason, the client's will NOT load when it's running on my VPS.
However, when it runs on my real desktop, it works 100%. I tried changing the client IP to my VPS IP and that did not work.
MORE INFORMATION:
When I try to run it, I get error_game_js5connect. I know what this means, it's not connecting to the IP. I set the IP in loader.java to my VPS' IP and I get error_game_js5connect. Any ideas?

item.title: VPS hosting problem
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Talk to the vps company, ask to see if ports 43594 and 5555 are open, if not, ask them to open them for you.

Read full topic

item.title: VPS hosting problem
item.dc:creator: @dylanscaper dylanscaper
item.description:
@dylanscaper wrote:

ultimatepkvillage:

download no-ip program http://www.noip.com/downloads.php?page=win on your vps then login with your details, on the no-ip program go to preferences and check the box that says use alternative ip method. Next change go into your client folder and change the client ip to your no-ip.(biz,org,info) on your vps and it should load

Tried this still get the same error.

I have portfowarded, I have no-ip, I changed ip’s. I really don’t understand this at all. I feel as if I have wasted my money. If anyone can help via teamviewer or skype, please pm me on here or add my skype: dylan.brewer61

Read full topic

item.title: VPS hosting problem
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

download no-ip program http://www.noip.com/downloads.php?page=win on your vps then login with your details, on the no-ip program go to preferences and check the box that says use alternative ip method. Next change go into your client folder and change the client ip to your no-ip.(biz,org,info) on your vps and it should load

Read full topic

item.title: VPS hosting problem
item.dc:creator: @dylanscaper dylanscaper
item.description:
@dylanscaper wrote:

[quote=“SurrealRSPS, post:4, topic:528310”][quote author=dylanscaper link=topic=647060.msg4351441#msg4351441 date=1376707149]

portforward?

Most VPS’s automatically come with ports open. But if I were to need to portfoward, how would I do that on vps?
[/quote]

Mine you go into the administrator tools and go into the firewall. And create rules for 43594 (or the port you’re using).[/quote]

Tried this. still not working. mind getting on skype or teamviewer?

Read full topic

item.title: VPS hosting problem
item.dc:creator: @SurrealRSPS SurrealRSPS
item.description:
@SurrealRSPS wrote:

[quote=“dylanscaper, post:3, topic:528310”][quote author=Muroth link=topic=647060.msg4351440#msg4351440 date=1376706953]
portforward?
[/quote]

Most VPS’s automatically come with ports open. But if I were to need to portfoward, how would I do that on vps?[/quote]

Mine you go into the administrator tools and go into the firewall. And create rules for 43594 (or the port you’re using).

Read full topic
